oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Physics with the new WASA-at-COSY facility
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BHATT, H
CHANDWANI, K
NANDI, BK
SHAH, NK
SCHANDMAND, S
VARMA, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: electromagnetic structure
eta-meson
light meson decays
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Wide Angle Shower Apparatus (WASA), previously operated at Uppsala, Sweden, is now installed at the COSY accelerator at Julich Forschungszentrum, Germany. The main goal of the WASA-at-COSY collaboration is to study symmetry violations in hadronic reactions focusing on eta and eta' decays. The Nuclear Physics Institute at Julich Forschungszentrum and Department of Physics at IIT Bombay are collaborating to understand QCD at intermediate distance scales using the proton beam from the COSY accelerator with proton and deuteron targets. In this paper, we present the preliminary analysis on three different channels being investigated jointly by the two groups.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 20th International Conference on Ultra-Relativistic Nucleus Collisions,Rajasthan, INDIA,FEB 04-04, 2008
